Title: environmental-impact-of-the-covid-19-pandemic-lesson-for-the-future
Text: Covid- 19 pandemics forced factories shut , flights getting canceled massive decrease global economy , significant decrease Green House Gases ( GHG ) many developed developing countries.The SARS- CoV2 came spotlight December 2019 impacted countries till . Nearly 131 million peoples infected worldwide resulting deaths around 2.9 Million according World Health Organisation ( ) . countries dealt new virus imposing strict lockdowns social distancing control spread virus . policies caused adverse effects worldwide . One important impacts Covid-19 Pandemic environment.There positive impacts environment due lockdown like , air pollution decreased dramatically , people asked stay houses due lockdowns . also sharp decline environmental noise . Environmental noise well defined unwanted harmful outdoor sounds caused human activities like noise emitted road traffics , air traffics , rail traffics , industrial activities . one important challenges modern era noise pollution cause adverse effects humans well harm many animals . imposition lockdown quarantine various nation ’ governments caused people remain back homes . , movement people one place different place reduced significantly use personal public transport also decreased . Due changes , environmental noise generated cities dropped substantially.Water Pollution beaches reduced significantly many animals spotted back cities , covid-19 virus also generated many negative indirect effect environment.To begin , developed countries halted sustainability program pandemic . United States many European nation-States , waste recycling plants suspended many municipalities cities due concern virus getting spread recycling centers . resulted increase use single-use plastic bags instead re-usable bags many leading restaurants , firms , corporations . instance , Starbucks , leading coffee company month March 2020 , announced short-lived ban utilization recyclable reusable cups.Furthermore , people staying indoors lockdown majority department stores , shops , restaurants , food outlets closed , making online purchase food delivery quite high . created consumption demand fossil fuels due transportation mobility goods individual . enormous upsurge medical waste- products employed healthcare professionals usually single-use items used disposed . wastes include used masks , personal protection kits , gloves . instance , nearly 200 tons medical waste generated peak pandemic breakout Wuhan , China . 50 tones average waste generated outbreak Wuhan.These organic inorganic wastes generated due policies crafted government takes heavy toll environment cause environmental issues like water pollution , air pollution , soil erosion , harm local flora fauna.The demand masks pandemic become skyrocketing materials required production masks highly dangerous environment generally composed non-woven fabrics . Polyester , Polystyrene , polyethylene , polycarbonate , common materials used surgical mask density lying 20grams 25 grams/sq . meter . materials mostly resistant liquids plastic-based products really high afterlife discarded . treated properly without discarding , end filling landfills oceans making dangerous aquatic lifeforms . example , recently environment Hong Kong started degrading drastically pandemic accumulation clinical wastes.With recycling plants hold , piles small mountains wastes depositions open areas formed due increasing number unrecycled wastes generated every day . makes surrounding vulnerable also creating high risk air pollutions dumped open wastes decays Methane ( CH4 ) , greenhouse gas , hence increasing risk global warming . surroundings getting affected careless methods , local people also getting affected . excess methane gets accumulated Earth ’ atmosphere due piles unrecycled wastes , could result increases Earth ’ average temperature harmful future generations.Many protected endangered flora fauna facing much greater risks due imposition lockdown . Many countries lockdown made people stay inside homes . employees , NGOs , volunteers working protected areas like National Parks , Marine Conservation Zones , wildlife sanctuaries made stay home making protected endangered flora fauna unattended . also led increase many illegal activities like wildlife hunting , illegal deforestation , fishing activities due absence people . prohibition eco-tourism also led significant financial drop economy protected areas.Some nations like China asked local authorities native government bodies increase amount disinfection routine , mainly increase dosage chlorine wastewater treatment plant prevent spread COVID-19 virus . However , according ( 2020 ) , solid evidence found survival virus lifespan virus wastewater well drinking water . Despite fact excessive amounts chlorine water cause harmful problems issues associated people ’ health like bladder cancer also damages cells.The COVID-19 reminder health planet also linked health humans . Title: global-financial-crisis-2008-causes-effects-and-its-solution
Text: Brief Financial Crisis 2008 started crisis subprime mortgage market ( i.e . market lending loans done people may difficulty maintaining repayment schedule simple terms , loans given people without proper checks low credit scores ) ultimately led onto huge global collapse.The Financial Crisis 2008 Great Recession considered worst economic crisis since Great Depression.Financial Crisis Explained –In year 1996 , dot-com boom ( otherwise known dot com bubble ) United States , period massive growth use internet stock market prices started increasing rapidly . Real Estate ) .During time , Investment Banks saw opportunity , chimed started buying loans Banks bulk clubbed multiple loans complex derivative called CDO ( Collateralized Debt Obligations ) started providing Investors getting credit rating “ AAA ” ( Safe Investment ) Credit Rating Agencies . Approximately 70 % CDO ’ marked “ AAA ” rating.Investment Banks Credit Rating Agencies enjoying large profits time . Moody ’ ( credit rating agency ) profits increased 4x times period ( 2000-2007 ) .Looking huge profits made Investment Banks Credit Rating Agencies , Insurance companies ( like AIG ) started giving insurance CDOs investors called CDS ( Credit Default Swap ) . AIG believed since CDOs rated “ AAA ” ( Safe Investment ) , failure chances CDOs minimal . misjudged unaware fact loans clubbed CDOs Sub Prime loans.Now CDO Investors started buying CDS AIG companies safeguard protect losses . AIG started making huge profits premiums investors pay . never realized outcome chance CDOs fail point time . Thus , risk factor got transferred CDO investors Insurance Companies.Fig – Flow Diagram showing Risk Factors got transferredComing loan borrowers , Sub Prime Borrowers banks unaware fact Adjustable Rate Loans ( interest rate loans keeps changing ) thus pay lower interests start interest rates later on.The borrowers started defaulting loans interest rates increased dramatically around 2007 thus banks resell houses make loans defaulted . Added problem fact borrowers spending amount money pockets taking loans banks providing full amount loans . Almost 50 % borrowers pay anything pocket bought home using housing loan.This led huge increase defaulters borrowers ultimately banks auction houses gain credit back . high-interest rates one buy auctioned houses , ultimately caused chain reaction banks longer receiving credit . prices Real Estate started falling drastically people good credit scores earlier taken housing loans also started defaulting price houses/homes fell loan amount taken earlier . Banks stopped receiving money also chain reaction , value CDOs ultimately came 0.Some Investors went huge losses Investment companies went bankrupt ( ex – Lehman Brothers ) . Moreover , insurance companies pay back investors taken insurance . result , insurance companies also went bankrupt . AIG almost lost $ 100Bn paying back investors earlier insured CDOs . However , US Govt . finally decided bail AIG order save going bankrupt.CDOs CDSs regulated time Federal Reserve thus whole situation ultimately led credit crunch ( became difficult get loans ) whole economy US underwent crisis led global impact around world . Unemployment increased manifold many new businesses shut . Global trades around world also saw crisis finally , Global Recession hit World.Causes Crisis –Improper screening loan borrowers resulting subprime loan borrowers included even borrowers stable income.Credit rating agencies rated CDOs highly investors purchasing without proper monitoring . goes Insurance companies.Lax regulation CDOs CDS ’ federal reserve banks.The large size interbank lending compounded crisisEffects Crisis –House prices plummeted.The unemployment rate increased US EU.8M people lost jobs globally2.5M business devastated4M houses foreclosed.Approx . $ 450Bn losses ( Banks Investment Banks combined ) Ways Avoid Crisis Future –Tighter regulations loan screenings.Regulations prevent banks growing big preventing systemic risks ( addressing ‘ Big Fail ’ problem ) Borrowers must made aware rate adjustable loansCredit rating agencies rate CDOs without proper risk assessment.Partnership Fintech companies develop robust alternative credit scoring models people less credit history.Strict regulation CDOs CDS ’ Federal BanksBlackcoffer Insights 19 : Neermalya Pratim Das , SCMHRD-Pune

Title: changing-landscape-and-emerging-trends-in-the-indian-it-ites-industry
Text: COVID 19 pandemic reshaped fundamental fabric world . Initiating China late December 2019 , virus since spread every corner world , infecting millions wake . Countries around world responded shutting economies advocating lockdowns varying degrees . India arguably one stringent lockdowns countries , restricting movement people , goods effectively transforming every city ghost town.Due stringent restrictions movement , economy received fatal blow . virus arrived India time country already strife , dealing slowing GDP growth rate ever-increasing fiscal deficit . lockdown simply exacerbated economic predicament ; pushing multiple businesses industries moribund state . countries also faced similar predicament , particularly US Europe , hotspots virus transmission.However , upon taking closer look global economy , seems upward mobilization sectors domain . sectors seem exorbitantly increased scale operations overall reaped hefty profits . differentiates areas rest learn ? path victoryIf look evolving IT/ITeS industry around world , domains flourished strenuous time one key characteristic common ; flexibility . sectors adopted flexible approach dealing lockdown . flexible working procedures adopting newer , advanced ways working line requirements time , ’ shied away changing rules game . Let ’ look areas within tech domain successful conquering lockdown.Social MediaLockdowns around globe confined people inside homes , nothing much significance . result , social networking sites reported gigantic rise user engagement lockdown period . Reportedly , close 50 % rise daily text transmissions across messaging platforms Facebook , Instagram , WhatsApp hardest-hit economies . Twitter reported 23 % increase user base compared last year . data makes evident social media platforms reap benefits lockdown situation.Video consumption sites YouTube , Instagram , TikTok line reap massive profits . ’ wonder viewership platforms increased manifolds due lockdowns . platforms serve distraction tragedies real world stressing times offer easy escape . rumors regarding cure COVID 19 , gossips , rap battles ; platforms provide viewers much-needed dose distractions . say , “ ignorance bliss ” .Data-Mining EnterprisesThe lockdown proven miracle data-mining companies . exorbitant increase number hours spent online globally , firms access significantly larger sets data otherwise could ever . Widespread implementation data-mining seen recently countries opting Government-regulated surveillance applications monitor movement times . Moreover , applications access personal information well medical records . Countries South Korea Singapore helm relying means control outbreak.Although noble , initiatives raise red flag regards user privacy . public provided little information applications operate goes behind scenes . creates atmosphere obscurity frankly harmful premise democracy.Cloud ComputingCloud computing rise last couple years . However , pandemic made de facto king terms computational services . increasing reliance remote working , ability store data one secure location turned critical.The cloud computing services Amazon Web Services , Microsoft Azure , Google Cloud reaped hefty profits process . emerging landscape tech world seems suggest upward trend reliability services far large scale data storage computing concerned.E-CommerceSocial distancing measures made practically impossible people physically go shopping groceries necessities . Moreover , majority retail outlets cities reported negligible engagement , fear transmission virus . E-commerce sites real winners predicament global consumerism.With high standards hygiene at-home delivery , sites provided easy alternative retail stores . similar businesses include food delivery apps grocery sites also flourishing today amidst pandemic . Recent weeks made evident E-commerce websites well way abolish traditional shopping methods.OTT PlatformsOnline streaming platforms consist relatively newer approach entertainment ; existence past couple years . already , however , established name lockdowns . Sites Netflix Amazon Prime dominating chunk market share competing heavily movie theatres new releases , . lockdown practically deleting theatres cable TV collective psyche entertainment industry , well way becoming platform choice far entertainment masses concerned.This already become evident , Zee5 India reporting whopping 80 % increase subscriptions 50 % increase time spent site , within first couple weeks lockdown . Another platform MUBI reported 28 % rise viewership India week lockdown commenced . facts clear indication exponential growth store platforms , unlikely change anytime soon.Video-Conferencing PlatformsThe idea working home set new norm professional culture , requires easy effective way communicate internet . audio text , video conferencing need today . Hence ’ understandable multiple video conferencing services set reap massive profits new norm.Arguably popular , Zoom reported 130 % increase price share since beginning 2020 . Another platform known Microsoft Teams collaboration suite , operated Microsoft , reported whopping 12 million increase user base first week lockdown US . data likely upwards trajectory considering increasing pace industries going online.The Indian PictureThe Indian landscape also undergone massive cultural changes . According Rajesh Gopinathan , chief executive officer managing director Tata Consultancy Services Ltd. , “ work home ” model operations stay . also claimed firms requires 25 % workforce physically present project locations.Tata Consultancy Services one major players Indian landscape shifted almost 90 % workforce remote borderless workspace model , smaller firms followed suit . tells us ’ headed direction ’ unlikely return . Remote working appears modern protocol operations unlikely change anytime soon.However , major challenge often overlooked circumstances adaptable culture . culture workspaces drastically altered members workforce dive headfirst new way business . critical ensure industry combat pandemic recover gloriously.A duality unlike otherThe lockdown presented us stark contrast unlike ’ witnessed . one hand , industries mentioned seem exhibiting exponential growth people thriving every possible resource disposal , unorganized sector MSMEs ( Micro , Small Medium Enterprises ) seem crux death.The sector consists people guidelines work home irrelevant never really option ; people fixed wages social security fall back time crisis . result lockdown , several MSMEs effectively become inoperable resorted massive layoffs survive . resulted thousands workers losing jobs nowhere go refuge . chunk people includes migrant workers lost jobs left little avenue feed . receiving significant support government , people initiating treks back villages . witnessed massive influx migrant workers flooding highways , walking weeks find shelter food . Truck drivers responsible delivering goods also resigned stating means eat closure every food joint highways . realities present stark contrast expose deep crack societal framework . One reckon ’ heal anytime soon.A train Unlikely HaltThe COVID 19 pandemic restructured social fabric way unlikely change anytime soon . areas ’ discussed likely become flagbearers digital revolution decade . upward mobilization regards massive scale movement industries online seems pertinent today led domains industry . unfortunate consequence majority MSMEs may soon cease exist , replaced alternatives ’ discussed . seems never-ending circle ones making profit situation continue , others washed collective memory.Blackcoffer Insights 18 : Souvik Chakraborty , Indian Institute Engineering Science Technology , Shibpur

Title: online-gaming-adolescent-online-gaming-effects-demotivated-depression-musculoskeletal-and-psychosomatic-symptoms
Text: Introduction video game software program played computing device , personal computer , gaming console , mobile device . Video games existence since early 1970s become increasingly popular , spanning different mobile ( smartphones , tablets ) stationary ( computer console ) platforms . Advances , particularly mobile devices , given birth social networks group gamingAlthough nature gaming require physical stamina therefore limited factors age , gender , fitness , popular adolescents . 2018 , World Health Organization ( ) classified gaming disorder International Classification Diseases ( ICD-11 ) . ICD-11 list diseases medical conditions aids health professionals making diagnoses treatment plans patients various disorders . noted , inclusion gaming disorder ICD-11 generated vigorous sometimes contentious debate discussion within medical mental health community . Although recognized area clinical interest , Diagnostic Statistical Manual Mental Disorders ( DSM-5 ) published American Psychiatric Association suggests clinical research required Gaming Disorder formally considered psychiatric disorder . Similarly , notes inclusion gaming disorder ICD-11 , encourage research excessive gaming behavior , including prevention treatment.What Online gaming disorder ? 2018 draft 11th Revision ICD-11 denotes disorder pattern “ digital-gaming ” “ video-gaming ” behavior characterized impaired control gaming activity , increasing priority given gaming activities extent gaming takes precedence interests daily activities , continuation escalation gaming despite occurrence negative consequences.Online Gaming disorder similarities Internet gaming disorder ( IGD ) , condition American Psychiatric Association ( APA ) noted DSM-5 area need additional study . APA currently recognize IGD official condition . gaming disorder diagnosed , criteria require behavioral pattern gamer must sufficient severity major noticeable impairment deterioration personal , family , social , educational , occupational important areas functioning present minimum 12 months.Signs symptoms Online gaming disorderAccording definition , person online gaming disorder demonstrate following characteristics least 12 months ; problems controlling control gaming habits , seeing gaming important necessities daily activities work , continuing engage gaming even negative health social problems identified evident . research shows gaming disorders also linked anxiety , depression , obesity , sleeping disorders , stress . People remain physically inactive long periods gaming may also higher risk obesity , sleep disorders , health-related issues , according [ 1 ] .Health consequences video Online gamingVideo game-related health problems cause continuous strain injuries , skin disorders , health issues . problems according Shoja et al . ( 2007 ) , include condition could termed video game-provoked seizures patients pre-existing epilepsy . following health consequences video gaming reported.Vision issuesVideo game playing associated eye problems . Extensive fixed staring video game screen causes eyestrain cornea , pupil , iris biologically equipped chronic heavy viewing digital images electronic devices . visual system strain frequent video game use extended periods may result headaches , dizziness , cases , nausea vomiting . Interestingly , research shows gamers enhancement spatial distribution attention , compared non-gamers . somewhat predictable practice effect occurs peripheral central visual attention . sufferers amblyopia ( dimness blurring eyesight due fault transmission eye brain ) video games may helpful.Musculoskeletal problemsPersistent gamers may also suffer musculoskeletal problems . survey children indicated increased physical complaints associated video game playing . complaints range pain hands wrists back neck . Furthermore , case report involving nine-year-old teenager referenced Playstation thumb . Playstation thumb , characterized numbness blister caused friction thumb controller rapid persistent gameplay . Using dermoscopy , dermatologists discovered hemorrhages onycholysis ( loosening separation fingernail ) patient presented hyperkeratosis . Also , tendon injuries ( tendinosis ) hands wrists tendon overuse , another health problem associated video game playing . Furthermore , another case report New England Journal Medicine reported fracture base fifth metatarsal people play Wii video games . condition termed ( perhaps sarcastically ) , Wii fracture . also postural problems associated persistent playing video games , although , ergonomic measures ( including chair monitor position ) could potentially improve postural problems associated video game playing.Obesity overweightPlaying video games consistently associated obesity . maybe related lack physical activity players . Alternatively , could less physically fit obesity gravitate towards less physically demanding activities , gaming . either case , several studies linked television video games increased Body Mass Index ( BMI ) . estimated children United States spend 25 % waking hours watching either television playing video games . Furthermore , children watch hours television play video games highest incidence obesity . video games replacing physical activities young people participate physical recreation see playing video games form recreation , may part link times spent playing video games rise BMI teenagers . Evidence potential link gains support German study reporting boys spend 1.5 hours per day engaged television watching playing video games , 75.4 % less likely overweight spend 1.5 hours engaged activity.In 2011 study , association video game activity increase ( mostly junk ) food intake reported . Specifically , single video game sessions caused increase food intake , regardless appetite . also suggested active video game play using two popular gaming platforms opposite effect . researchers found evidence active video games would result beneficial outcome although study demonstrate increase amount physical activity within children receiving active video games.Seizures ( Epileptic ) Health concerns video games may cause epileptic seizures started early 1980s . first medically documented case video game-induced seizure reported 1981 . 1993 , story popular press ( Sun newspaper ) reported boy choked death vomit seizure triggered playing video game . Similar less serious incidents subsequently reported news media around world , ultimately motivating video game console manufacturers include epilepsy warnings instruction manuals gaming products . 1994 reported video games cause seizures people already predisposed epilepsy advised people predisposition epilepsy greatly reduce risk seizure staying 10 feet away TV set wearing sunglasses playing video games . clearly area need additional research.Prevention treatment online gaming disorderThe cost : benefit value prevention versus treatment addiction disorders known many years . important beneficial make use several types strategies combating gaming addictiveness disorder . Effective strategies include : educating gamers gaming behaviors consequences mental health ; treatment geared towards helping gamer control his/her urge video games , recognizing dealing disturbing thoughts learning cope without video games ; intrapersonal interpersonal counseling help gamers explore identity , build self-esteem , enhance emotional intelligence outside fictional world gaming learning communication assertiveness skills needed social interactions ; family involvement , including counseling discussion family relationships ; developing new lifestyles . latter particularly important paraphrase well-known mantra Alcoholics Anonymous , ’ , people , places , things . prevent persistent playing video games , people need explore new activities , set new goals metrics achievements beyond video game scores.Blackcoffer Insights 18 : Harsh Arya , Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College Ghaziabad

Title: coronavirus-impact-on-energy-markets-2
Text: coronavirus , also known COVID-19 , global public health emergency also source significant regional increasingly global economic disruption . impacts energy climate world many ways . economic downturn puts pressure global oil prices leading Organization Petroleum Exporting Countries ( OPEC ) consider cuts production . hurts demand natural gas time extremely low prices . changes economic , energy , climate policymaking environment China , one consequential energy consumers sources greenhouse gas emissions . temporarily disrupted supply chains throughout energy industry , including renewable energy , time supply chain connections China revaluated due ongoing tariff trade disputes . consequential transformative changes energy sector climate efforts depend upon ultimate trajectory virus outbreak itself— Sarah Ladislaw , Senior Vice President Director , Energy Security Climate Change ProgramThe energy sector already felt impacts coronavirus . outbreak contributed dampened demand oil , resulting plummeting oil prices production declines . move forward , , energy sector expects face two headwinds : managing issues health emergency sectors face , simultaneously coping low oil-price scenario , lower demand need shore revenue manage debt obligations . IMPACT COVID-19 INDIAN ENERGY MARKETSIn India , distribution utilities lower tariff domestic agricultural consumers , sometimes even average cost supply , compared commercial industrial consumers . Table 1 provides electricity tariff rates Delhi selected consumer categories highlight differences . Thus , several distribution companies , lower tariff-paying consumers cross-subsidized commercial industrial consumers.CategoryFixed Charge ( ₹ /KVA/Month ) Energy Charge ( ₹ /KWh ) Industrial2507.75Single point delivery supply Group Housing Societies1504.50Agriculture1251.50Table : Electricity Tariff Schedule FY ( 2019-20 ) – Delhi Electricity Regulatory Commission ( DERC ) COVID-19 lockdown led shut essential commercial activities across country . Approximately 1.3 billion citizens obliged remain within confines homes , many cases , allowed work home . Consequently , electricity demand industrial , commercial customers reduced significantly residential demand expected increased . According Power System Operation Corporation India ( POSOCO ) , energy met March 16th , 2020 – considered business-as-usual scenario – 3494 MU compared 3113 MU March 23rd , 2020 day voluntary curfew . reduced range 2600-2800 MU March 25th March 31st , 2020 . trend illustrated Figure 1.Figure1 : Daily energy met ( MU ) Thus , firstly , key risk COVID-19 pandemic already struggling distribution companies India arises loss revenues due reduction demand commercial industrial customers well inability cover cross-subsidies provided lower-tariff paying consumer . Secondly , utilities would also account expense comply ‘ must buy ’ commitments generators long-term power purchase agreements . true full extent risk would known quantitative analysis conducted crisis situation contained . Thirdly , operational level , distribution companies would account deviation demand supply patterns temporal locational level . Finally , period , critical infrastructure electricity networks would run minimum employees.COVID-19 impact power marketAs seen Figure 1 , trade wholesale power market comprises 4.3 percent total electricity transactions . However , transactions power exchanges grown last decade . Indian Energy Exchange ( IEX ) seen growth 2616 MU FY 2009 52,241 FY 2019.Figure2 : Share market segments total electricity generation 2018-19 ( Source : CERC ) , trade wholesale market four market segments:1 ) Day-Ahead Market 2 ) Term Ahead Market 3 ) Renewable Energy Certificates4 ) Energy-saving certificates . Recently , Central Electricity Regulatory Commission ( CERC ) finalized regulations implementing real-time markets . half-hourly market enable intra-day trade electricity , allowing adjustment generation consumption profile day . COVID-19 pandemic , announced CERC real-time market would operational April 1st , 2020 . However , starting date delayed two months June 1st , 2020 . According media reports , due COVID-19 pandemic , required trials could completed . delay real-time market implementation likely serious , adverse impact Indian power market.Another impact COVID-19 pandemic power markets terms market dynamic . observed dip clearing volume market-clearing price , coincides gradually increasing shutdown measures taken government response COVID-19 ( See Figure 2 ) . Thus , reduction demand due lockdown reflected volumes traded electricity market clearing price.Another point reference price clearing volume 2019 . March 22nd , 2020 , day voluntary lockdown , clearing volume 97.05 GWh , clearing price 2195.48 ₹ /MWh . comparison , day 2019 , clearing volume 107.98 GWh , clearing price 2816.18 ₹ /MWh . start lockdown , March 25nd April 1st 2020 , average clearing volume 104.27 GWh compared 130.24 GWh 2019 period . Similarly , average market clearing price 2155.93 ₹ /MWh 2020 compared 3371.025 ₹ /MWh 2019 period . Title: what-is-the-repercussion-of-the-environment-due-to-the-covid-19-pandemic-situation
Text: COVID 19 pandemic ? 31st December 2019 , novel coronavirus identified Wuhan , China . spread like wildfire world . 11th March 2020 , declared COVID 19 pandemic issued guidelines like Sanitizing hands regularly , wearing masks , social distancing viable methods prevention virus.What social distancing helpful ? Social distancing means staying away people . , limit human interaction various governments world chose life economy ordered complete lockdown countries . schools , colleges , offices , factories , public places , etc . shutdown immediate effect.As 7th June 2020 , COVID 19 confirmed cases worldwide 69,94,605 4,02,453 deaths 34,20,048 recovered.The USA ’ impose lockdown early stages due nearly 19,88,545 confirmed cases death rate 5.6 % ( 7th June 2020 ) whereas India lockdown imposed first stage , 2,47,000 confirmed cases death rate 2.8 % .Impact EnvironmentRights reserved StatistaAs know us , Humans , keep exploiting nature nurtured us turn blind eye havoc misdeeds . Current environmental concerns like depletion ozone layer , climate change , soil erosion , air pollution , water pollution , soil pollution , acid rain , noise pollution , loss biodiversity , many result selfish never-ending desires development cost environment.But lockdown imposed worldwide , lives stopped . Air traffic ( due flights ) dropped 95 % ( Cntraveller ) . Since one allowed leave homes , Carbon footprint per person dropped significantly . Hindu newspaper reported 17 % decline carbon pollution pandemic peak . According article Economic Times onMay 14th,2020 , Global air quality improved year due lockdown.Economic Times posted article 8th April 2020 titled “ COVID 19 : world ’ zoo , time animals outside humans inside ” .This sounds like lock good Environment . Right ? Humans getting deserved , animals safe environment healing due reduction pollution levels.But , NO.All tip iceberg .The reality humans , despite threat due COVID 19 , cyclones , earthquakes , locusts attacks still damaging environment.According Voicesofyouth.org : ” also increase medical waste – much personal protective equipment healthcare professionals using worn disposed . Hospitals Wuhan , example , produced 200 tons waste per day peak outbreak , compared average fewer 50 tons prior . “ According Mongabay News : “ Despite COVID , Amazon Deforestation racing higher . new figures come amid rising fears illegal loggers speculators using COVID-19 crisis opportunity invade indigenous lands protected areas Brazil ” .According article Conservation International , expert said ” Africa , alarming increase bush meat harvest wildlife trafficking directly linked COVID-19-related lockdowns , decreased food availability damaged economies result tourism collapses ” Apart above-mentioned media channels , various news articles reported incidents various locations around world.Now , think : COVID 19 helped environment good deteriorated ? Check yourself.Follow social distancing guidelines . Stay Safe .Blackcoffer Insights 18 : Anjali Pal , Lady Shri Ram College Women

Title: contribution-of-handicrafts-visual-arts-literature-in-the-indian-economy

COVID-19 decline China . new cases every day Europe China epidemic ’ peak Italy surpassed country deaths virus took 67 days reach first 100,000 confirmed cases worldwide , 11 days increase 200,000and four reach 300,000 confirmed cases – figure exceeded . Human Consequences recent weeks , seen significant economic impact coronavirus financial markets vulnerable industries manufacturing , tourism , hospitality travel . Travel tourism account 10 % global GDP 50 million jobs risk worldwide . Global tourism , travel hospitality companies closing affects SMEs globally . , turn , affects many people , typically least well-paid self-employed working informal environments gig economy part-time work zero-hours contracts . governments announced economic measures safeguard jobs , guarantee wages support self-employed , lack clarity many countries measures implemented people manage loss income short-term . Behind statistics lie human costs pandemic , deaths friends family physical effects infection mental trauma fear faced almost everyone . knowing pandemic play affects economic , physical mental well-being backdrop world , many , increasingly anxious , unhappy lonely . Fear unknown often lead feelings panic , example people feel denied life-saving protection treatment may run necessities , lead panic buying.Psychological stress often related sense lack control face uncertainty . cases , lack information wrong information , either provided inadvertently maliciously , amplify effects . huge amount misleading information circulating online COVID-19 , fake medical information speculation government responses . People susceptible social media posts apparently trustworthy source , often referred “ Uncle Masters ” -post , possibly amplified spread “ copypasta ” posts , share information copying pasting make new post look like original source , opposed posts “ liked ” “ shared ” “ retweeted ” . Sadly , criminals hackers also exploiting situation significant rise Coronavirus-themed malicious websites , 16,000 new coronavirus-related domains registered since January 2020 . Hackers selling malware hacking tools COVID-19 discount codes darknet , many aimed accessing corporate data home-workers ’ laptops , may secure outside office environment . Social distancing lockdowns also prompted altruistic behaviors , part sense “ ’ together ” . Many people report bored concerned putting weight ; others discovered slower pace life going socializing found time family , others , even pets . downside self-isolation social lockdown symptoms traumatic stress , confusion anger , exacerbated fear infection , limited access supplies necessities , inadequate information experience economic loss stigma . stress anxiety lead increased alcohol consumption , well increase domestic family violence.In Jingzhou , town near Wuhan Hubei province , reports domestic violence lockdown February 2020 triple number reported February 2019 . Essential Actions Business Community Health measures must first priority governments , business society . important businesses show solidarity work together protect staff , local communities customers , well keeping supply chains , manufacturing logistics working.According research , “ employer ” trusted government media . Daily updates company website input scientists experts recommended counter politicized messages media governments . particularly true large companies capacity . Messages businesses employees communities also important . companies helping schoolchildren vulnerable families longer get school meal ; others providing public health messages effective handwashing . Even CEOs show working home self-isolating , still effective leadership . Following advice , need business community move general support specific actions focus countries ’ access critical supplies , including “ Community Package Critical Items ” ( list 46 items countries need ) . items , 20 either available locally available stocks limited . missing items fall four categories : Hygiene : Chlorine , HTH 70 % , alcohol based hand rub , liquid soap ; Diagnostics : lab screening tests , lab confirmation tests , enzymes , RNA extraction kits ; PPE : gowns , scrubs , aprons , sterile gloves , protective goggles , face shields , masks ( N95 FFP2 ) ; Case management equipment : oxygen concentrators , oxygen delivery systems , mechanical ventilators . call action money , work manufacturers create capacity organize purchasing guaranteed access , especially poorer countries less resilient public health systems . concept create global security stockpile supplies equipment , effort needs : Emergency financingAccess increases manufacturing capacityAccess national supplier stockpilesWarehouses distribution capacity Blackcoffer Insights 17 : -Jatin Tiwari , Gurukul Kangri Deemed University , Haridwar

Title: covid-19-how-have-countries-been-responding
Text: COVID-19 pandemic impacting communities world.With 149 offices countries worldwide , leading global effort support countries preventing , detecting , responding pandemic . also monitoring response : 143 countries COVID-19 response plans , almost ( 194 ) countries adopted public health response measures based ’ guidance.The response also covers procurement supplies . 2 March , bought shipped 1.5 million coronavirus test kits close 800 000 face masks across planet , delivering personal protective gear 70 countries . time , half ’ personnel responding ground providing real-time updates , expertise , coordination governments , humanitarian agencies , public race respond.Countries adopting different ways contain spread coronavirus one-size-fits-all approach.Towns cities locked large gatherings banned.Restrictions imposed travellers hard-hit areas , China , Italy Iran.Major sporting events , carnivals events postponed cancelled.The COVID-19 coronavirus spread every continent except Antarctica , challenging health systems governments everywhere . Although vast majority almost 90,000 cases around world China virus originated , 64 different countries * affected.For , virus represents mild health issue , vulnerable members society consequences serious . Containment remains priority countries one-size-fits-all approach tackling spread disease.FranceThe French government advised citizens abandon customary “ bise ” greeting – involving kissing cheek – bid slow spread COVID-19.Public gatherings 5,000 people also limits , resulting cancellation events like Paris Half Marathon . Following decision , Louvre museum Paris closed doors public mitigate threat infection posed visitors arriving different parts world.IranAs Middle East ’ worst hit country , nearly 3,000 cases COVID-19 reported Iran , including 20 lawmakers . country ’ parliament suspended indefinitely MPs asked cancel public meetings.Iran ’ death toll third highest , China Italy , medical supplies running short . Exports face masks banned three months , Iran ’ factories produce new supplies local people.GermanyGerman Health Minister Jens Spahn declared coronavirus ‘ worldwide pandemic ’ , something World Health Organization concluded point . government banned export medical equipment , Spahn said virus yet reached peak.United StatesCalifornia declared state emergency first death state , brought U.S. death toll 11 . move follows Washington Florida declaring state emergency , 10 deaths Washington state . government preventing entry anyone visited China last 14 days expanded testing nationwide.SwitzerlandPrecautionary measures place Switzerland , gatherings 1,000 people banned , forcing cancellation annual events like Basel Carnival Geneva International Motor Show . Interior Minister Alain Berset also advised using country ’ customary three-kiss greetingAustriaAuthorities Austria imposed ban trains travelling key international routes Italy , Brenner Pass . move followed two suspected cases coronavirus discovered train heading Italy southern Germany , later tested negative . temporary ban lifted , allowing scheduled rail services Austria Italy resume.ItalyItaly shut schools universities 10 days , government also banned public conferences cultural events curb spread virus , already killed 100 people.Some towns northern Italy ’ Lombardy region lockdown . Restaurants businesses closed , threatening plunge country recession.Curve confirmed Covid-19 cases outside CHINAChinaAt epicenter outbreak , China adopted aggressive measures contain virus , including city lockdowns , travel restrictions , extending school breaks closing theatres , sporting events , public venues . Infection rates continue increase , rate increase slowed.Hong KongHong Kong ’ border mainland China closed , preventing visitors entering territory . Without throng global tourists usually flock Hong Kong , economy hit hard . Schools closed April , many flights restricted canceled . Hong Kong ’ recently unveiled budget included government payment $ 1,200 resident help ease economic painJapanJapan ’ Prime Minister Shinzo Abe called elementary , middle , high schools close late March , impacting millions students . threat posed virus could jeopardize Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games , due held summer , although decision cancel event announced.Saudi ArabiaNo coronavirus cases detected Saudi Arabia , regional neighbours like Kuwait Bahrain . Authorities barred entry kingdom foreign pilgrims 25 countries , preventing visits Islam ’ two holiest sites – Mecca Medina.United Arab EmiratesFerry services UAE Iran suspended commercial ships must provide health statements crew members 72 hours arriving country ’ busy ports.South Koreaouth Korea cases nation outside China . Strict self-isolation requirements force throughout country , fines potential prison sentence awaiting anyone found violating rules.After military personnel tested positive disease , planned annual joint military exercises US forces put hold.Blackcoffer Insights 17 : -Mayuri Nakashe , – Rashtrasant Tukdoji Maharaj Nagpur University , Nagpur ( RTMNU )

Title: coronavirus-impact-on-the-hospitality-industry-2
Text: Coronavirus affected life every individual , also affected various industries better worse . certain industries like Pharma , Mobile Web-streaming industries , Fitness Teleconference apps boomed pandemic , industries like Tourism , Fast-Food Industry , Retail Leisure sectors suffered worst hit due Coronavirus ImpactDuring lockdown prevent spreading Coronavirus Impact , almost companies adopted work-from-home culture used various Teleconference apps hold meetings . Teleconference apps also used college institutions universities studies ’ get disrupted . Also , confined homes , people started engaging fitness apps , web streaming services like Netflix , YouTube , Amazon Prime zenith.While industries thriving pandemic , affected industry time Hospitality Industry.Hospitality Industry embodies various sectors like transportation , traveling , airlines , hotels , lodges , etc . Hotels traveling also major part Tourism Industry . tourism Hospitality industries may appear somewhat similar , subtle distinctions . Tourism mainly involves traveling services away home . hospitality industry involves businesses services concerned leisure enjoyment mainly run customer experience satisfaction . customers may also local inhabitants along tourists.The hospitality industry majorly divided Accommodations , Travelling , Food Drinks . Accommodations include hotels , resorts , hostels , motels , etc . best hotels resorts basking peeks , option lay employees . Many hotels zero occupancies led immense loss hotel establishments . case resorts , hostels , motels , etc . provide accommodations . Since occupants , money inflow , leading layoffs employees owners able provide paychecks anymore.Businesses accommodation sector started , finding difficult cope situation . Various governments extended small business bridge loans cope situation . accommodations sector way cope situation wait situation improve improve business.Traveling restrictions imposed various governments avoid spreading Coronavirus . Travel agencies , car rentals , tour operators , flights , airlines hit quite severely COVID-19 . Due fear spreading Coronavirus , people limited public outings stopped stepping altogether unless shop daily essentials . Coronavirus Impact travel ban lays restrictions travel . Many international domestic flights suspended tackle Coronavirus crisis . Havoc created across aviation industry.The months March May said busiest times year tours travel industry . people reluctant travel fear catching Coronavirus getting stuck abroad governments announce restrictions , thereby overstaying visas imply future travels abroad . Airlines tourism agencies stopped marketing advertising would irresponsible make sense crisis.To cope situation , airlines like Virgin Atlantic American Airlines started deploying passenger flights carry cargo , various airlines laid . Commercial travel dropped tremendously . Also , recent drop jet fuel prices . estimated many airlines going go bankrupt situation persists.Apart airlines , cruise industry travel agencies also take toll year . facing cancellations bookings , new travel agencies risk closing rendering employees either losing jobs going unpaid leaves time crisis.It predicted pandemic situation control , travel tour industry take 10 months return normalcy . However , outbreak may affect entire tourism industry ’ future.Many foods drinks services fall hospitality industry offer people services provide leisure time . customers include tourists locals , passerby ’ , etc . mainly include restaurants , tea coffee shops , bars pubs , catering , etc.Catering provided places mainly social gathering , deliver food drinks services provided according organizer ’ preference . Due pandemic , many countries lockdown , even lockdown allowed hold public gatherings safety precaution . Due avoidance public gatherings events maintain social distancing , catering services halted now.Restaurants , tea coffee shops , pubs , bars closed safety customers also keeping mind safety employees workers . However , restaurants offer food delivery still working , taking necessary health sanitation precautions prevent spreading Coronavirus . number restaurants seems declining increasing cases COVID-19 customers becoming afraid cautious situation . Though , quick-service food deliveries cope better full-service restaurants crisis.Because unprecedented crisis , industries affected hoping government support make tough times . Without financial support help government institutions , difficult various establishments survive crisis.It indicated world face worst recession since Great Depression pandemic many people losing jobs , especially working hospitality industry . Thus Coronavirus Impact different industriesBlackcoffer Insights 17 : - Mehdia Fatima , Jamia Millia Islamia

Title: coronavirus-impact-on-the-hospitality-industry-3
Text: hospitality sector India witnessed unprecedented deceleration year wake COVID-19 pandemic . Indian hotel sector hit hard , tussling significantly low demand , future bookings . Many businesses operate low margins fragile cash flow already prospect survival indefinite period time without income seemed bleak indeed . taken mental toll already stressed business owners worried staff . FACTS & FIGURES – Coronavirus Effect Hospitality : impact novel coronavirus India ’ hospitality sector jobs nothing short severe . economists expect things rebound latter half year , uncertainty still lurks . sheer job trauma staring hospitality industry near future . chances losing job high risk . Furthermore entry-level postponed hiring near future . Let us check facts concerning drop various hotel occupancy sectors . country ’ daily hotel occupancy dropped 11 % 23-29 March , according preliminary data STR , Department Revenue , Ministry Finance , Government India due COVID-19 concerns , limitations intensified India . Along steep downward trend occupancy , average daily rate ( ADR ) , revenue per available room ( RevPAR ) also dropped significantly India . ADR , dropped year year around 20 % eight consecutive days , went low INR4 , 924.18 28 March . RevPAR attained least absolute level ( INR537.54 ) 22 March . India , luxury budget hotels running 10 percent occupancy levels thousands people canceled trips . may worsen times come least till end year . instance , Airbnb announced guests could cancel reservations full refund . overall revenue Indian hotel sector set decline anywhere US $ 8.85 billion US $ 10 billion , reflecting erosion 39 % 45 % compared last year . Besides actual business loss , hotel owners also incur losses due fixed operating expenses , debt repayments , interest payments , several compliances required undertaken part sector . hospitality travel sectors among worst affected COVID-19 , OYO ’ entire executive leadership ( CXOs ) team taken voluntary pay cut , starting 25 % , many opting supplementary untapped amount , going 50 % enable constructing runway company . Ritesh Agarwal , Founder & Group CEO , OYO Hotels & Homes , decided forego 100 % salary rest year wake novel coronavirus crisis . Proposed Action Plans -Coronavirus Effect HospitalityThe hospitality industry use chasm prepare upcoming demand focusing marketing up-gradation . ‘ Stop Gap Plan ’ maintaining thread communication , using social media advertisements , consumers . ’ also strengthening communication within company , making budget plan re-opening , utilizing period fix upgrade whatever possible . Another step action required sector . outbreak virus contained world set travel , suggested plan re-opening must done keeping long-term benefits safety compliances mind . imperative hospitality companies reach deferred canceled bookings give due attention domestic travelers . hotels airlines must slowly roll services rather starting everything instantly get caught spending.This way Coronavirus Effect HospitalityA Way Forward : Recommendations Government IndiaThe government already taking measures combat effects pandemic country . multiple measures , taken government India , help Indian hotel industry weather current storm . Stimulus package stabilize support hospitality sector near term , including workforce support fund ensure job losses . Provide moratorium ~ 6 – 12 months loans ( principal & interest ) , including working capital payments overdrafts . Ensure credit rating agencies downgrade ratings businesses , due expected volatility business short medium term . Provide 12-month corporate tax holiday travel , tourism , hospitality sectors . Defer statutory dues advance tax , custom duties , excise duties , PF , bank charges , etc . central state level 12 months . government authorities must ensure adequate availability collateral-free interest-free credit organizations hospitality , travel , tourism industries . CORONAVIRUS LEAVE BEHIND ? Really anyone ’ guess . ’ yet know long take epidemic peak us allowed , one thing sure ’ desperate meet friends dinner pint pub ! proper support government think hospitality industry stands good chance bouncing back quickly , perhaps former form . likely see kind natural selection take place among restaurants , leaving space innovative new entrants . crisis already forced several restaurants innovate developing new services perhaps , regulation allows , stick , becoming new models restaurants future offering diverse resilient set revenue streams . Thus Coronavirus Effect Hospitality sectors.Blackcoffer Insights 17 : -Radhika Kejriwal , IMT Nagpur

Title: covid-19-how-have-countries-been-responding-2
Text: “ anything kills 10 million people next decades , ’ likely highly infectious virus rather war ” – Bill GatesBill Gates TedX address 2015 pointed predicament world leaders failed invest sufficiently health infrastructure elaborated inability prevailing health facilities accommodate next pandemic world would face.The whole world grappling COVID-19- virus took birth city Wuhan spread across globe , claiming half hundred thousand lives affecting two million people.With fear virus spreading , whole world entered complete stringent lockdown mandated national governments . caused economic activities worldwide come standstill except sectors provisioned essential goods services . international agency-IMF projected global output contract 3 % 2020 even worse 2008-09 financial crises . Moody downgraded global growth forecast 2.5 % 2020 earlier estimate 5.3 % . US economy expected contract 2 % , Euro-era 2.2 % China expected grow 3.3 % rather earlier estimate 6 % 2021The national governments presented inevitable challenges ensuring sustenance livelihood masses , improving investor confidence preventing economies falling recession absence consumerism amidst uncertainty longevity future intensity pandemic.The GOI took decision enter lockdown preliminary phase spread virus . Indian economy fiscal year 2019 already hit severe NPA crises . witnessed downward spiral grew mere rate 5 % 6.8 % 2018 per statistics released NSO-National Statistical Organization . manufacturing construction sectors negative outliers . government order recuperate announced plethora decisions . government cut corporate tax 30 % 22 % manufacturing enterprises 25 % 15 % . order strengthen position public sector banks , government announced merger 10 public sector banks 4The government also announced fiscal stimulus 1.7 lakh crores INR stepping fiscal deficit target order drive economy downward spiral get path growth , giving lubricant economy facing liquidity crunch heightening NPA.But Coronavirus outbreak halted economic activity posed government issue fulfilling basic survival needs workers informal sector wake massive urbanization . daily wage earners tried walk native places huge numbers posing immense difficulty government . Apart domestic equity market indices- BSE Sensex NSE Nifty crashed reflected erosion investor confidence reflected stealth bearish sentiment around world.All amalgamated together posed serious question survival huge chunk Indian population invited lot criticism government.This Central NDA government announced fiscal relief package : Central government announced fiscal stimulus additional INR 1.7 Lakh Crores constitutes approximately 0.8 % India ’ GDP Pradhan Mantri Gareeb Kalyan Yojna . fiscal stimulus used target underprivileged section society instead conventional indirectly lubricating economy deficit financing.The government NFSA-National Food Security Act decided provide additional 5 kg Indian staple wheat rice 1 kg pulses every month people ration cards . government expanding accelerating dissemination unilateral transfers various government schemes . PM Kisan Scheme Indian farmer receives payment INR 6000 three installments every year . 6000 GOI disbursed INR 2000 immediately . government made provision providing 2 installments INR 1000 next three months already availing old ages , women , disability pension . women Jan Dhan account holders receive INR 500 next three months . government assured availability cooking gas providing 1 LPG cylinder next three months 8.3 crores people covered Ujjwal Yojna . government order prevent deterioration encourage entrepreneurial spirit already discriminated rural women government made provision Women SHG ’ receive collateral-free loans INR 20 Lakhs NRLM ( National Rural Livelihood Mission ) . government also enhanced payment MGNREGA INR 180/day INR 202/day.The government also taken upon provide EPF contributions 12 % basic salaries employees employers next three months . order ensure household liquidity employees withdraw EPF accounts balance 75 % . GOI also providing insurance coverage INR 50 lakh tenure 3 months 22 lakh health workers government hospitals inclusive ASHA workers , medical , sanitary workers , paramedics.The finance minister Nirmala Sitaraman also pointed increased money supply combined dollar swap USA help curb inflammatory effect also.Shaktikanta Das , RBI chief announced monetary relief package economy seemed regain investor confidence national stock indices rallied . following elements package : repo rate rate commercial banks avail loans RBI . RBI cut Repo Rate 75 basis points 5.15 % 4.4 % . reduction cost borrowing RBI gives commercial banks incentive enjoy increased margins borrowing relatively lower rate past investing rate i.e . granting loans businesses households.Cut Reverse-Repo Rate 25 basis points 4 % 3.5 % . reverse repo rate rate banks park funds RBI . primarily implies reduction interest rate banks earn parking funds RBI . incentivizes lend . given commercial bank ’ acquaintance friction caused erosion consumerism due fear COVID-19 ; hard forecast successful aforementioned steps are.The RBI also announced moratorium provision defer payments EMI ’ home , car , credit card dues period 3 months 1st March-31st May . government also provided interest-free loans MSME sector meet working capital requirements lockdown uplifted.The RBI also announced refinancing window INR 50,000 crores financial institutions like Nabard , National Housing Bank , Sidbi.As markets crashed foreign institutional investors withdrew investments Indian Market , increasing demand USD increasing supply INR causing rupee depreciate . currency hit bottom low INR 76/ USD . prevent erosion value rupee RBI entered 6-month swap agreement US government . deliberation undertake currency swap began result panic-selling foreign exchange reserves fell around $ 7.5 billion two weeks $ 439.66 billion March 27.Despite tourism , hospitality , domestic trade , airline industry taking hit , India presented quite opportunities well.India came messiah export hydroxychloroquine USA , followed Indian pharmacy companies- Lupin , Dr. Reddy ’ Laboratories , Strides Pharma ’ plants India , Biocon ’ plant Malaysia given clearance US FDA-US Food Drug administration . gives massive export opportunities entities , improving growth prospectus . crash crude oil prices caused falling negotiations OPEC Russia creating supply pressure along lowered demand enabled India lower import bill . According report ICRA every $ 10 decline crude oil price saved India $ 15 billion.Not India countries like USA , Japan , UK , Germany announced massive fiscal stimulus packages equip economies come phase decelerating economic activity.US announced fiscal package $ 2 trillion approximately 9.3 % GDP . relief package largest relative GDP largest kind Modern American History . way larger $ 800 billion assistance provided 2008 . Germany introduced largest fiscal stimulus relation GDP.The following graph indicates fiscal stimulus proportion GDP respective countriesWorkers US whose annual incomes $ 75000 receive $ 1200 direct payments well $ 500 every offspring . America America came rescue businesses allocating $ 500 billion businesses local government bodies.It announced various sectorial packages- $ 50 billion passenger airlines , $ 8 billion cargo carriers , $ 17 billion businesses involved maintaining national security . Taking care small industry sector , US government committed devote $ 350 billion working capital requirements entities . government allocated $ 150 billion health care sector , $ 45 billion disaster relief fund , $ 31 billion education sector , $ 27 billion research development , $ 15.5 billion towards food stamp program .. Republican President Donald Trump lot criticism lately . tackling COVID-19 crises America could either relinquish Trump administration another tenure . far situation seems critical USA registered maximum number casesChina- epicenter pandemic facing lot backlash world powers like USA , UK , France , Germany ; country asking monetary compensation . US even alleged China conducted low-frequency nuclear tests whole world anguished . China also frowned upon acquiring stake various companies like-The PBOC enhancing claim HDFC 1 % many entities amidst panic selling . China also capitalized low crude oil prices creating massive buffers . exported PPE various countries , capitalizing minutest opportunities available.This time prudent try remain optimistic illuminated Charlie Munger , - “ would ……when worst typhoon ’ ever happened comes . want get typhoon ’ rather come whole lot liquidity . … ” Blackcoffer Insights 17 : Shreya Ahuja , Daulat Ram College

Title: lessons-from-the-past-some-key-learnings-relevant-to-the-coronavirus-crisis-2
Text: “ know past , better prepared future. ” Theodore RooseveltAs speak , world finds engulfed one worst crises recent times . global COVID-19 pandemic caused never-seen-before disruption public economic life . factories shut supply chains abruptly stopped millions workers stranded , festivals suspended , families separated across countries public-healthcare systems put tremendous stress . scenario first-time many , world pandemics similar scale nature , due struggle , emerged victoriously . experienced amongst us would remember , SARS MERS outbreaks early 2000s presented similar scenario , although much lower rate infection , yet higher rates morbidity . Going back time , 1918 Spanish Flu brought world first world war , standstill . Considered worst amongst modern-era pandemics , Influenza pandemic affected one-third world ’ population 50 million lives . Yet , preventive measures social-distancing , quarantine , mass-vaccinations , public support , restraint proved successful situations , even effective occasional plague outbreaks across world . face similar situation today – extremely infectious virus , already spread globally , confined people homes causing tremendous economic loss every minute economic activity remains suspended , affecting government industries alike . past similar incidents guide industries trying times ? governments take note public-policy measures adopted Spanish flu , SARS MERS outbreak helped eliminating pandemics ? Government learn ? panic due outbreak COVID-19 , importantly , lockdown measures deal , quite similar 1918 Influenza Pandemic , commonly referred , Spanish Flu . Large cities around world put strict lockdowns , businesses worldwide came grinding halt large chunks population became bedridden.The immediate consequences ones observed past weeks – rampant unemployment , supply shortages , heavy reliance social security systems , causing sudden strain national economic resources.Impact & LearningsInformation & CensorshipEffective transparent communications one crucial useful tools disease control . Iran presents great example damage unleashed media-blackout . Secondly , censorship might best way appease masses times . long-term political impact media censorship manipulation epidemic-related facts China yet seen . Still , short-term international unrest dissent deteriorated international relations . risk quoting cliché well established Streisand effect , truth always comes , matter many countries try hide it.Isolation , Lockdown & Distancing Mechanisms WorkThe Spanish Flu spread aggravated due failure policymakers adopting effective containment measures . Research shows US cities undertook measures reduce contact amongst citizens early-1918 displayed significantly lower peak death rates compared cities failed late adopt disease containment policies.To quote results 2007 study , “ Consistent hypothesis , cities multiple interventions implemented early phase epidemic peak death rates ≈50 % lower less-steep epidemic curves . also displayed lower cumulative mortality. ” 1 : Contrasting Death Rates Philadelphia v. St. Louis 1918 Influenza Outbreak1 : Contrasting Death Rates Philadelphia v. St. Louis 1918 Influenza OutbreakAs one might guess , Philadelphia late levy restrictions gatherings , parades , social distancing measures , whereas St. Louis not.From study , see definition popular phrase “ flattening curve ” emerging – spreading rate infection time , enabling health care systems treat people staggered manner , line available resources . , corroborate result , following graph study shows different trajectories followed disease two cities US.Hence , regardless multiple debunking claims social-distancing & lockdown effective preventive mechanism , previous epidemics taught us perform marvelous job ‘ flattening curve ’ .Premature Relaxation DisastrousSocial Distancing & Lockdown measures effective , sustained , least months , even things start improve.Markel ( 2007 ) , shows disastrous consequences early relaxation bans public gatherings St. Louis death rates , Spanish flu . pullback social distancing measures pursue economic interests premature caused sudden , unprecedented surge number deaths due flu . 2 : Deaths due Spanish Flu St. Louis – Wider Picture . black & grey lines show duration social-distancing measures active.2 : Deaths due Spanish Flu St. Louis – Wider Picture . black & grey lines show duration social-distancing measures active.Another peak death rates observed cities relaxed distancing measures prematurely . Hence , crucial consider past artifact governments compare inconveniences public & damage caused economy due measures , benefits nation terms human life saved , make call restrictions must eased.What industry learn ? industry played key role obscure fight worldwide outbreak . faces fair share challenges , unprecedented times.Supply Shortages , due shut-down factories & production houses uncertainty production systems would resume normal functioning.Transport disruptions , due closure & quarantining cities state-borders ; nation-wide lockdowns bringing transportation standstill ; significant disruptions supply-chains goods.Labour issues , restrictions movement , come issues labour welfare , unrest employment security . problem even serious labour force migratory nature.Global industries weathered multiple natural disasters two epidemics similar scale nature . recovery-paths immense strategic implications current policy-makers offer strategic insights , helping companies chart short-term & long-term strategies.3 : graph looks retail sales impact SARS epidemic China 2003 ; earthquake , tsunami Fukushima nuclear disaster Japan 2011 ; MERS epidemic South Korea 201.53 : graph looks retail sales impact SARS epidemic China 2003 ; earthquake , tsunami Fukushima nuclear disaster Japan 2011 ; MERS epidemic South Korea 201.5Three phases characterise impact retail market three cases : ShockRecoveryStabilizationThe paths inevitably converge stabilization follow different trajectories , swayed public perceptions externalities , case mid-autumn festival South Korea . Looking retail sector micro-lens , past crises show demand trends vary amongst product categories , post crisis . three categories usually follow trends : Demand Trends & post Pandemic-generated Crisis4 : Demand Trends & post Pandemic-generated Crisis4 : Demand Trends & post Pandemic-generated Crisis [ 1 ] three trends valuable tool large scale players regional retailers means prioritize predict consumer-demand consequently alleviate sudden strain product supply chain arising sudden & unexpected demands.Change Consumer BehaviourA peculiar outcome epidemics somewhat permanent changes instilled consumer buying trends across inflicted regions , across product categories – Fresh staples see sharp rise demand product hygiene & safety standards ranked higher consumers ’ priority list . Hence , advantage lies producers quickly integrate changed consumer-preferences products , showcase product reliability & quality , priced competitively , given prevalent context . Lastly , previous pandemics consolidated long-standing theory , true retail sector consumer-centric industry , – Consumer Loyalty tried tested times . Effective Consumer Relationship Management ( CRM ) forge bonds go long way , weathering thick thin unprecedented times.ImplicationsAlmost two decades ago , SARS outbreak China pushed entrepreneurs established players embrace dawn e-commerce era . outbreak expected accelerate shift conventional brick-mortar based commerce centralized online cloud-store based mechanism . Survival , FMCG sector least , decided great extent breadth supply chain networks ability overcome severe bottlenecks.The past shown even though established large-scale players deep pockets extensive networks , likelier chance tough hard times , even regional players & SMEs make , strengthened community-support , empathy importantly , local relationships.What fail learn ? global pandemic outbreak made one thing painfully clear – lack global collaborative research ways combat spread infectious diseases . words Johan Neyts , professor virology president Belgian-based , International Society Antiviral Research ( ISAR ) , health authorities failed incorporate learnings SARS outbreak early 2000s , partly economic crisis 2008 squeezed funds potential research could undertaken partly lack seriousness authorities considering efforts involved dealing future expected breaks coronavirus due seven different strains existence . Way forward ? lessons come caveat – Things change time . modes communication changed . information & travel much accessible . fast planes & faster internet . better healthcare capabilities much better , perfect , healthcare system . 1918 , people ’ even know virus causing pandemic much eradication . Today , already extensive research going 70 different probable vaccines virus , record setting pace clinical trials approvals.We much better equipped 100 years ago , time , somewhat under-equipped deal . lessons various similar crises humanity faced risen , act glimmer hope dire times , put good use , aid fight COVID-19 . words Howard Markel , “ ’ never better time human history pandemic today , exception next week month later . want kick road , ’ today. ” Blackcoffer Insights 17 : Nishant Kumar Satyam , Vasu Golyan

Title: lessons-from-the-past-some-key-learnings-relevant-to-the-coronavirus-crisis-3
Text: current topic burning world alive deadly coronavirus . Let us first understand coronavirus actually . According World Health Organization ( ) , Coronavirus disease called COVID-19 infectious disease caused newly discovered Coronavirus . Many people complaining feeling bored aimless . people may even feeling breach individual rights , made stay home .
