Title: why-scams-like-nirav-modi-happen-with-indian-banks
Text: India beset financial scams since Independence . Every 4-5 years , Indian citizens hear many trillions public money misappropriated eventually lost people public supposed start . article , examples , would like point two factors scams like Nirav Modi : complicity actors within financial industry systemic loopholes emerging financial system used scams like Nirav Modi.The first financial scam Independent India found 1958 Feroze Gandhi , MP found 1957 , Haridas Mundhra got government-owned Life Insurance Corporation ( LIC ) invest Rs . 12.4 million ( US $ 3.2 million time ) shares six troubled companies Mundhra held large number shares trying boost rigging market . investment done governmental pressure bypassed LIC ’ investment committee , informed decision deal gone . event , LIC lost money . Several leading stockbrokers LIC Investment Committee testified investment could made purpose propping market , claimed Finance Ministry , LIC consulted Investment Committee , would pointed Mundhra ’ forged shares episode 1956 . Finance Minister T. T. Krishnamachari , testimony , tried distance LIC decision , implying may taken Finance Secretary , Justice M.C . Chagla held Minister constitutionally responsible action taken secretary disowns actions . Eventually , Krishanamachari resign . Nehru government suffered considerable loss prestige incident.The 1992 Indian stock market scam stock market scam orchestrated Harshad Mehta . scam took place Mumbai biggest market scam India . 1992 scam systematic stock fraud using bank receipts stamp paper caused Indian Stock market crash . scam lead complete structural change security system India introduced completely new system stock transactions . 1992 scam exposed Indian financial systems inherent loopholes system . scam led reform security system India introduced online security systems . scam orchestrated way Mehta secured securities State Bank India forged cheques signed corrupt officials failed deliver securities . Mehta made prices stocks soar high fictitious practices would go sell stocks owned companies . 1992 scam raises many questions involved many bank officials responsible collusion Mehta . 1992 scam caused investigation many officials implicated fraudulent charges . security system India took rapid reform fundamental structure post 1992 scam . first major structural change formation National Stock Exchange India ( NSE ) . first major reform financial sector India formation CII Code Desirable Corporate Governance developed Rahul Bajaj . Post-1992 , new regulatory board known Securities Exchange Board India formed monitor National Stock Exchange National Securities Depository . structural changes equity market . government introduced ten acts parliament one constitutional amendment based upon principles economic reform legislative change equity market . NSE introduced online trading 1994 changed dynamics stock buying selling . capital market opened nationally opposed confined Mumbai . exchange system started functioning based satellite communications abolished geographical barriers.In 2001 , Ketan Parekh purchased large stakes less known small market capitalization companies jacked prices circular trading traders , collusion companies large institutional investors . resulted steep hikes share prices . later transpired promoters industrialists often gave Parekh funds artificially rig share prices . set ten stocks colloquially referred “ K-10 ” stocks Parekh playfully referred “ Pentafour ” . RBI commenced investigation Parekh . Around time , bear cartel brokers Mumbai opposed Parekh tried dump shares K-10 stocks . Panicking , Parekh sold entire ownership so-called K-10 stocks successfully jacked past two years . resulted stock market crash next day , resulting large-scale losses large institutional investors , including insurance companies mutual funds . 30 member Joint Parliamentary Committee ( JPC ) investigation ensued found Parekh involved circular trading throughout time period variety companies.When Securities Exchange Board India ( SEBI ) started scanning entire spectrum IPOs launched 2003 , 2004 , 2005 , ended digging dirt probably prevented larger conspiracy hijack market . involved manipulation primary market—read initial public offers ( IPOs ) —by financiers market players using fictitious benaami Demat accounts . transferred shares financiers , sold first day listing , making windfall gains price difference IPO price listing price . time , fraudsters targeted primary market make quick buck expense gullible small investors . Direct Participants ( DPs ) used retail applicants ’ shares reaping benefits stock market.The 2010 fake housing loan India uncovered Central Bureau Investigation ( CBI ) India . CBI arrested eight top-ranking officials public sector banks financial institutions , including LIC Housing Finance CEO Ramchandran Nair , connection scam . CBI alleged officers various public sector banks financial institutions received bribes private financial services company , acted mediator corporate loans facilities financial institutions . bank officials sanctioned large-scale corporate loans realty developers , overriding mandatory conditions approvals along irregularities.The Thane police , struggling crack tax refund scam taken income tax department ride defrauded central exchequer around Rs 3 crore , concluded scam involved high-ranking officials I-T department State Bank India . fraud-involving two I-T offices Thane Kalyan planned familiar I-T office functioning . two years , 2007-2008 2008-2009 , I-T officials disbursed tax refund cheques drawn SBI credited account fictitious assessees credit society Dombivli . many 331 tax refund cheques , exceeding Rs 1 lakh , subsequently routed Dombivli Nagri Cooperative Bank funds withdrawn . I-T refunds account payee cheques , ’ transferred . Despite , 331 refund orders credited third-party account credit society.The Saradha Group financial scandal major financial scam alleged political scandal caused collapse Ponzi scheme run Saradha Group , consortium 200 private companies believed running collective investment schemes popularly incorrectly referred chit funds Eastern India . feared legitimate non-banking financial companies microfinance institutions would stigmatized , leading vicious cycle low depositor trust , higher interest rates , lower lending localized credit crisis . Saradha Group depositors came lowest economic strata , loss investment would cause decrease social mobility . scandal drew attention similar illegal deposit mobilizing companies , facing increased regulatory pressure . Many companies variations timeshare travel schemes , clear regulations . August 2013 , Central Government amended SEBI Act gave SEBI powers search seize without prior magisterial permission investigate illegal money collection schemes.NSEL case relates payment default National Spot Exchange Limited occurred 2013 involving Financial Technologies India Ltd payment default took place commodities market regulator , Forward Markets Commission ( FMC ) , directed NSEL stop launching contracts . led closure Exchange July 2013 . Three spot exchanges , NSEL , NSPOT , National APMC exempted government Section 27 FCRA conduct forward trading one-day contracts . done boost volumes economic viability improved . flawed recommendations FMC , Ministry Consumer Affairs ordered NSEL settle existing contracts launch fresh contracts , led crisis . Investigations led Enforcement Directorate ( ED ) Economic Offences Wing ( EOW ) revealed role brokers defaulters NSEL case . brokers mis-sold NSEL products clients assuring fixed returns . defaulters hypothecated stocks produced fake warehouse receipts siphoned entire default money . FIU ( Finance Ministry ) held NSEL came purview Forwarding Contracts ( Regulation ) Act ( FCRA ) therefore guilty failing several obligations law . black money watchdog slapped penalty Rs 1.66 crore several counts violating provisions Prevention Money Laundering Act ( PMLA ) NSEL . watchdog held failures deliberate willful hence , invite penalties.The NSE co-location scam relates market manipulation National Stock Exchange India , India ’ leading stock exchange . Allegedly select players obtained market price information ahead rest market , enabling front-run rest market , possibly breaching NSE ’ purpose demutualization exchange governance robust transparency-based mechanism . alleged connivance insiders rigging NSE ’ algo-trading use co-location servers ensured substantial profits set brokers . whistle-blower alleged trading members able capitalize advanced knowledge colluding exchange officials . written reply , Minister State Finance , Arjun Meghwal told Lok Sabha 2016 : “ architecture NSE respect dissemination tick-by-tick transmission control protocol ( TCP ) internet protocol ( IP ) prone manipulation market abuse.The Punjab National Bank Fraud Case relates fraudulent letters undertaking worth ₹11,356.84 crores ( US $ 1.4 billion ) issued Punjab National Bank Brady House branch Fort , Mumbai ; making Punjab National Bank liable amount . fraud allegedly organized jeweler designer Nirav Modi . Nirav , wife Ami Modi , brother Nishal Modi uncle Mehul Choksi , partners firms , M/s Diamond R US , M/s Solar Exports M/s Stellar Diamonds ; along PNB officials employees , directors Nirav Modi Mehul Choksi ’ firms named charge sheet CBI . bank initially said two employees branch involved scam , bank ’ core banking system bypassed corrupt employees issued LOUs overseas branches Indian banks , including Allahabad Bank , Axis Bank , Union Bank India , using international financial communication system , SWIFT . 1 March 2018 , government approved Fugitive Economic Offenders Bill deter economic offenders evading process Indian law giving powers government confiscate assets fugitive , including Benami assets absconding loan defaulters . bill covers wide range economic offenders include : loan defaulters , fraudsters , individuals violate laws governing taxes , black money , Benami properties , financial sector , corruption . March 2018 , Reserve Bank India scrapped banking instruments Letter understanding ( Lou ) Letter Comfort ( LoC ) attempt plug loophole improve banks ’ due diligence trade credit . bankers said LoUs LoCs led receiving banks depending completely issuing bank creditworthiness.As seen cases scams like Nirav Modi , two factors : action taken insiders systemic loopholes responsible majority Indian financial scams . improvement industry come loopholes closed accountability given held people working industry.Blackcoffer Insights 16 : - Sandeep Chakravartty , Publicis Sapient

Title: impact-of-covid-19coronavirus-on-the-indian-economy-2
Text: Nathan Wolfe Impact said “ commonalities among pandemics occur learn . One commonality comes animals one wait long. ” year 1720 plague , year 1820 cholera outbreak recent pandemic Spanish flu 1920 . researchers said pandemics exactly pattern coronavirus outbreak . However , precision pandemics occur exactly 100 years age makes us think better topic . Coronavirus disease ( COVID-19 ) one infectious disease declared global pandemic . people infected COVID-19 virus experience mild moderate illness recover without requiring special treatment . Older people , underlying medical problems like cardiovascular disease , diabetes , chronic respiratory disease , cancer likely develop serious illnesses . best way prevent slow transmission well informed COVID-19 virus , disease causes spreads . People protect others infection washing hands using alcohol-based sanitizer frequently touching face . COVID-19 virus spreads primarily droplets saliva discharge nose infected person coughs sneezes , ’ important also practice respiratory etiquettes ( example , coughing flexed elbow , etc ) . time , specific vaccines treatments COVID-19 . However , many ongoing clinical trials evaluating potential treatments.The first case pandemic India reported January 30th,2020 . increased substantially around country extent Indian Prime Minister announced 21-day lockdown around country.Rating agencies , global domestic , unanimous COVID-19 pandemic economic tsunami India . Even though country may slip recession , unlike Eurozone , US , Asia-Pacific stronger trade ties China , analysts believe impact India ’ GDP growth significant . fallout move spill financial year 2021 , begins April 1 . Moody ’ Investors Service , March 27 , sharply slashed projection India ’ GDP growth calendar year 2020 5.3 % 2.5 % . markdown second 10 days came prime minister Narendra Modi announced 21-day lockdown . Global Macro Outlook 2020-21 , Moody ’ cited severe liquidity constraints India ’ banking non-banking sectors hindrance growth . agency ’ forecast global economy even stark—a contraction 0.5 % ongoing financial year. “ Lower business volumes occupancies , sub-optimal efficiencies impact profitability companies . affected companies may initiate cost-curtailment measures , may enough given high fixed costs . could impair credit files , ” says Subodh Rai , senior director , CRISIL . Neeraj Kumar , migrant worker , decided flee . family joined throng people leaving city soon lockdown announcement made . Public transport systems stopped , leaving people choice walk . Mr. Kumar , wife , 10-year-old daughter already walked 40km ( 24 miles ) spoke . “ work , running away . buses , walk another 260km get village , ” said.The situation workers following lockdown better . Mohammad Alam one thousands workers standing food queue India ’ capital , Delhi.The factory worked shut Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced 21-day lockdown stop spread coronavirus.A daily-wage laborer , source income , forced come government center food . “ ’ know survive ; borrow feed family , ” says.India announced $ 23bn ( £18bn ) relief package help people like Mr. Alam Mr. Kumar part India ’ unorganized , informal industry employs 94 % population contributes 45 % overall output . industry already bearing brunt lockdown thousands finding unemployed overnight . “ No-one allowed go hungry , ” Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said announcing package – combination direct cash transfer benefits food security measures.But economic fallout unprecedented lockdown dire . Businesses closed , unemployment risen productivity fallen . India ’ growth engine actually sputtering well threat outbreak arrived . one fastest-growing economies world , growth slowed 4.7 % last year – lowest level six years.Unemployment 45-year high last year . industrial output eight-core sectors end last year fell 5.2 % – worst 14 years . Small businesses begun recover controversial 2016 currency ban came body blow cash-consuming informal economy . , experts say coronavirus outbreak likely cripple already frail economy.There little finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman RBI governor Shatikanta Das COVID-19 forces virtual lockdown commercial hubs India , like done China Italy . Lights Mumbai Delhi alone , nerve centers India , cause great damage Indian economy . Indeed , COVID-19 massive blow slowing Indian economy , particularly small business , SME sector recently shown improvement since demonetization took place.This war-like situation Indian economy malls theatres empty . Schools shut contingencies states even announced complete shutdown services . welcome government ’ measures , feel much needed done minimize economic impact . “ free extra rations sanctioned , poor access due ? ” wonders economist Arun Kumar. “ government devise way using army state machinery physically distribute food poor. ” thousands migrant workers stuck miles away homes , seamless distribution cash food needs government ’ top priority , adds . ’ migrant workers risk . Farmers also vulnerable potential economic shock lockdown – agriculture industry contributes nearly $ 265bn GDP . government says give farmers 2,000 rupees ( $ 30 ) April advance payment $ 80 annual pay-out tide situation. “ money inadequate exports stopped . Prices cities rise profiteering rural areas drop farmers ’ able sell crop , ” says economist Arun Kumar . outbreak happened critical farming time – new crop ready , waiting sold . Economists warn India ’ challenge transporting food villages cities midst lockdown . supply chains ’ work properly , lot food wasted lead massive losses Indian farmers . Experts warn India also brink major unemployment crisis . Economist Vivek Kaul says people work small businesses may end job salary losses . “ know places companies actively discussing many people need fire , ” says ’ . sector immune COVID-19 disruption , vulnerable . tourism industry see greater disruptions . World Travel Tourism Council calculated tourism generated 9.2 % GDP supported 42.673 million jobs . Tourism dependent states like Kerala , Karnataka earn huge forex disease continues many operators forced go business.In exports industry gloom doom surrounding COVID-19 palpable , crisis might also throw great opportunities India . already reports several Western manufacturers looking moving factories China . Many Indian chemical producers gone record received inquiries Western manufacturers earlier never used look towards India source . Tapping opportunities , however , require serious innovation policy front . Indian policymakers need hunker plan economic assistance help India ’ export sector survive immediate crisis also retain stability resume growth medium long-term.With flights suspended mid-April , shutdown also bound push India ’ fast-growing aviation industry peril . Centre Asia Pacific Aviation ( CAPA ) assessed Indian aviation industry post losses worth nearly $ 4bn year . likely cascading effect , affecting hospitality tourism industries . Hotels restaurant chains across country empty likely remain several months , sparking worries large-scale layoffs . automobile industry , key indicator country ’ economic growth , also forced hit brakes – experts estimating losses nearly $ 2bn.So , India ’ relief package enough ? Experts say ’ drop ocean compared bailouts countries US , China Singapore stimulus package constituting 0.8 percent FY20 GDP , par address urgent needs smaller businesses . Experts say India definitely needs larger stimulus package soon help businesses extraordinary crisis.Desperate times call desperate measures . India done well containing dangerous virus act swiftly decisively , protect economy . Clearly need greater fiscal-monetary coordination ensure optimal policy response.Blackcoffer Insights 16 : - Manan Batra ( Delhi college Arts Commerce ) Akshat Mittal ( Shri Guru Gobind Singh College Commerce , Delhi )

Subsequently , economy revive modestly consumers continue wary spending , affect long-term spending . next two years , model predicts economy grow 1.5–2 % , lower would grown otherwise , unequal recovery across sectors . Title: should-celebrities-be-allowed-to-join-politics

Indeed , various political theorists suggest anti-incumbency happens amongst effective strategies secure vote banks . 31st December 2018 , Ukrainian actor , screenwriter , director Volodymyr Zelensky played lead sitcom tells story schoolteacher accidentally becomes president . winter Zelensky claimed contesting presidential elections “ change mood timbre political establishment ” “ bring professional , decent people power ” . Zelensky took premise wildly popular show reel real , crushed rival , seasoned politician , incumbent Poroshenko landslide victory . Zelensky proved better representative people predecessor ? Title: how-prepared-is-india-to-tackle-a-possible-covid-19-outbreak
Text: Frankly , ! state public healthcare system , still vast , fragmented scale rapidly enough face challenge pandemic COVID-19 . origin public healthcare lies British colonial period facilities provided British officers families stationed India . 1960s onwards , independent government India stressed upon healthcare led creation modern public healthcare system India . healthcare system organized primary , secondary , tertiary levels . primary level Sub Centre ’ Primary Health Centre ’ ( PHCs ) . secondary level Community Health Centre ’ ( CHCs ) smaller Sub-District hospitals . Finally , top level public care provided government tertiary level , consists Medical Colleges District/General Hospitals . number PHCs , CHCs , Sub Centre ’ , District Hospitals increased past six years , although standards set Indian Public Health Standards . still critical challenges existing system.One major areas lack awareness diseases , especially communicable diseases among general population India . challenge becomes complicated lower strata society , especially poor households , migrant laborers homeless people proper channels communication available get necessary information health experts . Add low educational status , poor functional literacy , low accent education within healthcare system , low priority health population , among others see magnitude problem . According recent study initiated faculty students IIT-Hyderabad IIT-Bombay , Tier-1 cities , found 12 percent respondents switched public private mode third week COVID-19 . modal shift 9 percent Tier-2 cities 7 percent Tier-3 cities . Moreover , nearly 48 percent people said travel work third week March , whereas 28 percent frequency travel work . inquired cancellation trips cities using major modes transportation , around 18 percent said cancelled flights whereas , 20 per cent respondents cancelled train journeys . indicates awareness COVID-19 higher Tier-1 cities , comparison Tier-2 Tier-3 cities . national level , state level door-to-door campaigns along targeted media campaigns may enable knowledge pandemic spread fast among local populace.The second challenge access public healthcare India . Access ( healthcare ) defined Oxford dictionary “ right opportunity use benefit ( healthcare ) ” Physical reach one basic determinants access , defined “ ability enter healthcare facility within 5 km place residence work ” . Using definition , study India 2012 found rural areas , 37 % people able access IP facilities within 5 km distance , 68 % able access out-patient facilities . Furthermore , postulated general , rustic ( rural ) one ’ existence – one lives towns – greater odds disease , malnourishment , weakness , premature death.The third planning portion related preparedness pandemic . Planning pandemic COVID-19 never done extensively India recent history communicable disease spreads rapidly crowded locations , quarter population live . recent national lockdown called led increase police violence sensitized deal crisis humanitarian crisis facing migrant laborers , important part Indian economy , lost jobs facing lack public transport , force walk thousands miles reach native villages . ongoing slump economy exacerbated pandemic resultant lockdown . growing complaints healthcare professionals , fighting front pandemic , lack Protective Personal Equipment ’ ( PPE ’ ) protect patients COVID-19 . lockdown hit HIV+ chronic patients hard need constant medication maintain fragile condition . Elderly people , often alone medical conditions , left without essential support . Ironically , group people immediate threat COVID-19.I optimistically hoping , based ingenious creativity citizens , tide tough times fundamental changes healthcare system made sober learning experience prevent repeat happening today.Blackcoffer Insights 16 : -Sandeep Chakravartty

Text: Every prophet doom , unless also happens psychopath , hopes predictions borne . also true epidemiologists virologists warning world since January novel SARS-CoV-2 virus poses severe threat public health around world . name Coronavirus , vicious enough terrify otherwise fearless face ball game . Countries large poor populations including Brazil , India , Indonesia , Nigeria , Pakistan confirmed cases , slow respond threat , according NPR . Preventative care health education less accessible low-income people likely pre-existing conditions , catch COVID-19 , die . People living poverty also likely hold insecure jobs afford stay home sick work.In times crisis , International Labour Standards provide strong foundation key policy responses focus crucial role decent work achieving sustained equitable recovery mitigate impacts COVID-19 world work . standards , adopted representatives governments , workers ’ employers ’ organizations , provide human-centered approach growth development , including triggering policy levers stimulate demand protect workers enterprises.Policy responses focus two immediate goals : Health protection measures economic support demand- supply-side associated cause.First , workers employers families protected health risks COVID-19 . Protective measures workplace across communities introduced strengthened , requiring large-scale public support investment.Second , timely , large-scale , coordinated policy efforts taken provide employment income support stimulate economy labor demand . measures cushion enterprises workers immediate employment income losses , also help prevent chain supply shocks ( e.g . losses workers ’ productivity capacities ) demand shocks ( e.g . suppressing consumption among workers families ) could lead prolonged economic recession.In challenging times , many countries come forward protect workers workplace decisive measures combat spread disease , ameliorating pernicious effect economy labor market across three policy pillars : protecting workers workplace , stimulating economy labor demand , supporting employment income . policies include Working arrangements , including telework ; Occupational Safety Health ( OSH ) advice ; Expanded access paid sick leave ; Prevention discrimination exclusion . measures doubt help contain pandemic , respond emergency needs generated pave way gradual recovery , clear needs done . Title: what-are-the-key-policies-that-will-mitigate-the-impacts-of-covid-19-on-the-world-of-work

Pros cons industrial revolution 4.0 PROS CONS Industry 4.0 helps us improve operational performance efficiency . minimum machine downtimes , produce faster allocating resources cost-effectively efficiently . Data security issues one main concerns manufacturers believe investing smart factories may increase risk security breaches chance proprietary production knowledge theft . Since production processes automated , high-quality standards maintained lower manufacturing cost . Interoperability , information transparency , automation , integration production process critical changes lying ahead existing manufacturers . makes compliance easier – complying regulations industries like pharmaceutical medical device manufacturing manual process . Instead , industry 4.0 technologies make possible automate compliance including track trace , quality inspections , serialization , data logging , etc .
